page.title: 09TESTWOOD HOUSE
page.content: Testwood house is situated 2 and a half miles from the head of Southampton water,5 miles from the docks and 2 miles from the modern M.27 {It's history is long and varied.}The kitchen is certainly fifteenth Century and known to have been owned by Sir Richard Dayrell in 1482.Another occupant,James Touchet,7th Barron Audley, was beheaded on Tower Hill after leading the "Cornish Rebellion" against Henry VII. Testwood was later used by Henry VII and Henry VIII as a Royal Hunting lodge, because of it's ideal situation on the eastern edge of the New Forest.{The house and 15 acres {was bought by Williams,Humbert Ltd {(Vintners) in January 1958.}This is a Subsidiary of Edward Butler Wine group .
